meanings.definition: The mast nearest the bow on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors climbed the foremasts to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to secure the sails on the foremasts.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the foremasts, pretending to be the lookout.
meanings.sent4: The foremasts stood tall like guardians at the front of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The creaking of the foremasts echoed through the quiet night.

meanings.definition: The forward mast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The foremasts swayed gently with the rhythm of the waves.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the flag on the foremasts to signal their arrival.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the foremasts, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The foremasts pierced the sky like spears of a mighty warrior.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gleamed on the foremasts, creating a dazzling sight.
